CatDescriptText: Mr. Leon Greenberg, clothing store co-owner, Mt. Lebanon and Mr. Louis Pacini, Uptown, were part of the "Pittsburghers Speak Up" column published in the Pittsburgh Courier Newspaper, April 29, 1961, pg.7 with question: "Do you believe that Russia actually 'put a man in space'--in orbit around the earth, or do you think that it was a 'trial run' to test man and rocket, prior to an attempt to put him in actual orbit in outer space?" Mr. Leon Greenberg's answer reads: "If the news stories mean what they say, I tend to go along with them.  It seems to be a fact."  Mr. Louis Pacini's with question: "Do you believe that Russia actually 'put a man in space'--in orbit around the earth, or do you think that it was a 'trial run' to test man and rocket, prior to an attempt to put him in actual orbit in outer space?" answer reads: "I think they did..."
TitMainTitle: Two frames: Portrait of Leon Greenberg wearing trench coat and hat, standing in front of store window; Portrait of Louis Pacini wearing polo shirt and hat with braided band, standing in front of window with Notary Public sign
